name: Styler
description:
Styler is a Figma plugin that generates styles based on selected layers.

Basically, you can control your styles by changing layer properties and updating the styles.


Tutorials

Presented by Luis Ouriach aka @disco_lu

Batch create styles (color styles only):

https://youtu.be/3Pq2cd3KRHY

Batch create styles (text + color styles):

https://youtu.be/G5jvBftQPkQ



Features

Generate Styles

Is a multi-purpose action for creating, renaming or updating styles based on layer properties.

  • Create: when there is no match between layer and existing styles.
  • Rename: when there is a style attached to the layer and no style with desired new name.
  • Update: when there is a name match.


Apply Styles

It applies the styles based on the match between layer name and local styles.

The children of the selected layers are not affected.


Detach Styles

It detaches the styles on the selected layers.

The children of the selected layers are not affected.


Remove Styles

It deletes the local styles that are found on the selected layers.

The children of the selected layers are not affected.


Extract Styles

Extract all local styles as layers.

This will create layers in the current page based on the local styles.


Customize plugin

Plugin settings, more about this here.


Notes

  1. It is much faster to rename layers by using the native feature: Cmd R (Mac) or Ctrl R (Windows). More info
  2. Try to avoid same name for multiple layers. It will create a single style, but it will update its properties
  3. By default, for text layers it takes into account only the text properties, but is possible to get all the other properties by adding + as prefix to the layer name.


Some ideas for future changes

Those are still an open topic and I'll have to research a little bit to see if all of them have sense and will be helpful. Most of these ideas were already requested by some people.

  1. Update the code to be easier to expand and use something similar with the one from Automater (Rollup + Svelte).
  2. Change Apply styles to also match by layer properties. At first will be a perfect match, then will experiment with some degree of flexibility.
  3. Add independent commands for Create, Update, Rename.
  4. Testing some ideas of unlocking the ability to reorder the styles based on layer order.
  5. Improving Extract styles to be provide a better structure.
